alert.note: Alert for Cabarrus (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 09 at 4:15AM EDT until April 13 at 8:51AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by runoff from recent excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Cabarrus County in the Piedmont of North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of the Rocky River and associated tributaries, as well as nearby low-lying areas and flood-prone locations, is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 406 AM EDT, National Weather Service gauge data showed the Rocky River above Irish Buffalo Creek cresting around 17.1 feet. At this level, Pharr Mill Road between Rocky River Road and Sequoia Hill Road are likely submerged by one foot or more of water. Flood waters may cover Stallings Road and Mount Pleasant Road, and may approach Poplar Tent Road. - A slow drop in water levels along the Rocky River and nearby tributaries is expected through the morning hours. Although the current Flood Warning has been extended until 9 am EDT, additional flood advisories along the Rocky River in Cabarrus County could be needed through late morning or early afternoon. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Downtown Concord, West Concord, Harrisburg, Mt Pleasant, and the Charlotte Motor Speedway. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
